name: Comfort Inn JFK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed before an early flight from JFK. Small room but very clean, flat screen TV, comfortable king bed. Nice bathroom . The place looked new. Very friendly front desk. Mike recomended places for take -out food. We had a whole meal delivered. Next morning had a great breakfast and shuttle to airport. Not a great neighborhood but if you just want a clean, comfortable room at a great price, this is the place.
reviews.title: Very Nice, Great price

likes.liked: — Price, Very Clean, Breakfast and Shuttle to airport

reviews.text: I got a room that smelled like smoke. I spent most of my time doing business on the computer in the room so all my clothes smelled like smoke when I left.
reviews.title: Smoky room but good for the price

reviews.text: The clerk at the desk promised to change my room but it never happened.
reviews.title: Good Value at the Comfort Inn JFK Airport

reviews.text: On the positive side the internet connection was good and the staff agreeable.
reviews.title: Good Room at a Good Price

likes.liked: — Cheap, clean decent room close to the airport

reviews.text: The walk to Rockaway Blvd to look for food was a bit unpleasant as the area is sparce and you have to walk along the highway. I generally took the shuttle to JFK or ordered food delivered.
reviews.title: decent hotel

likes.disliked: — price is high for the hotel location

reviews.title: Had the basics
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor, which have never steered me wrong! I was surprised, however, that no one had mentioned that the hotel is in sort of an industrial area, so the two blocks to the subway could be terrifying late at night. Also, there are no restaurants nearby. We got in in the evening, and our choice was to have Chinese takeout or bad pizza delivered. Those are our only complaints, however. The shuttle from the hotel was great, the room was as promised -- good bed, good shower, quiet. Breakfast was good. I guess $175 is a good price for a hotel at the airport in New York, but it does seem a little steep for this hotel. The staff was fairly distant and disinterested, but we didn't really need them for anything, so that was all right. I wouldn't stay here again if I could find another hotel near the price that had a restaurant.

We stayed at this hotel for one night on June 25 before moving to another hotel in Mahattan. The hotel offered free shuttle to/ from JFK airport which was quite convenient. The room was quite small but newly renovated. The bed was comfortable and linens very clean. The bathroom had a new tub, granite counters and floors.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised by the small but newly remodeled rooms

likes.liked: — Free shuttle to airport and subway, free and fast internet, updated room

reviews.text: The free breakfast in the morning was not much but it provided a satisfiable quick bite. The free internet in the room had a very good and fast connection.
reviews.title: Close to airport, clean, and inexpensive

likes.disliked: — smallness of lobby, dinginess of immediate surroundings

reviews.text: The hotel recently started offering free shuttle to the Jamaica Center/ Archer Avenue subway station in the mornings at 9, 10, and 11 am. The shuttle serves two nearby hotels, Best Western and Holiday Inn Express also, so be sure to be at the lobby early. This saved us $15 cab ride to the subway station.
reviews.title: Excellent newly refurbished hotel

reviews.text: This is a good hotel to stay at only if you want to be close to JFK airport for it is located near a very rough neighborhood.
reviews.title: well suited

reviews.text: A recommendation for this hotel seeing as though it is advertised as an `Airport' hotel is to provide a courtesy shuttle to & from the hotel!. This hotel was v.basic & clean but I wld not highly recommend it. One of the advantages of this hotel though is that it is aprox 2 blocks from the nearest Marta station where you can take a train straight into the heart of Manhattan which, is a bonus.
reviews.title: Very basic hotel
IS THERE A MANAGER IN THE HOTEL???
reviews.text: The Reception staff was polite & quite informative in regards to `getting around' JFK & a light breakfast was included in the price which was overall fairly reasonable as we were only in JFK for aprox 8-9hrs before catching a v.early morning flight.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay in this hotel again if I was visiting JFK for a matter of hours however I wouldn't recommend this hotel if your stay in JFK is for a longer period.
reviews.title: Mold & mildew abounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a 2 nights stay at this hotel over the internet and gave my credit card number to hold the room. At the end of the stay I paid the bill ($313.88) cash and got a receid. I still got charged ($228.01) a week later on my credit card. I have called this Confort Inn six times in the last week to get credited. There is never a manager on duty and nobody knows his schedule (Eliott?). I left my phone number everytime but nobody is calling me back. Looking at the shape of the rooms and the level of service, I would recommand that travelers spend a few extra bucks and avoid this Confort Inn like the plague.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: Christian M.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay!
Stay here only if you have to...
reviews.text: Our flight from JFK to SFO was canceled due to the terror bomb plot. We scrambled around to find a hotel nearby JFK and found Comfort Inn JFK to be the most affordable we could find that night.

We called for the Comfort Inn complimentary shuttle from Station C at JFK, and it took nearly 30 minutes for the shuttle to arrive. Meanwhile, I saw Holiday Inn, Ramada, and other hotel shuttles come by to pick up guests at least 3 separate times.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed at

likes.liked: — Nothing - it was horrible. Should have stayed at JFK.

reviews.text: The staff at Comfort Inn wasn't rude...but their attitude shows that they definitely did not want to be there. We were given a key card that did not work. Meanwhile, a man, who looked more like a hoodlum said that the room we were trying to get into was really his room, and HE cannot get in there himself.
reviews.title: Decent hotel but...
Avoid like the plague
reviews.text: After all this was settled, we went into our room...and found a small double bed with bedsheets that were somewhat stained, and definitely way too large for the bed. The floor of the showers felt like they were in need for some bleach and scrubbing and we found a piece of hair on one of the towels.

The next morning, I checked out with a gentleman at the reception who talked on his cell phone the entire time and spoke of "capping" someone for his friend if needed. Needless to say, I was happy to be out of this place and onto my rescheduled flight.
reviews.title: Not what I expected

description: The Comfort Inn JFK Airport is just 0.75 mile from JFK Airport and allows quick access to Manhattan, Brooklyn, Bronx, and Long Island. This Jamaica, NY hotel is minutes from Aqueduct racetrack, Jones Beach State Park, Rockaway Beach and Nassau Veterans Memorial Coliseum, home of NHL's New York Islanders. New York City and its many popular attractions are only a quick drive away. 32" flat screen televisions in the rooms. Located with-in 3 miles of the Newly Opened Resort World Casino at Aqueduct Racetrack!
